TopicTitle: [WIP][1.9.x-1.12.x] Scatterer-atmospheric scattering (0.0838 - 14/08/2022) Scattering improvements, in-game atmo generation and multi-sun support

Articles.Content:
Hello blackrack, thank you for your beautiful mod.

Is it known if there's some kind of a conflict between the current release version of scatterer and reflections from TextureReplacer? I've found out that if I use scatterer and some reflective textures from WindowShine or <abbr title="KSP Renaissance Compilation (mod)">KSPRC</abbr>, I will get some weird artifacts instead of nice looking reflections. The artifacts are most obvious on the EVA helmet, but they seem to appear on any reflective texture. Without scatterer installed, the reflections work properly. I've tested this quite thoroughly with only scatterer and TextureReplacer installed, and the conflict seems to be indeed between these two mods.

However, with the newer "Tracking Station" version of scatterer, the reflections seem to work fine. I have an AMD GPU in case it might matter.

Here's a picture on imgur showing the problem:

[https://imgur.com/a/5YsUB](https://imgur.com/a/5YsUB)

I'm not adverstising anything, and it's not me who made this wonder possible - it's [@RangeMachine](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/149069-rangemachine/) who revived good old <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr> 7.4 and made it work in KSP 1.2.2

I don't know why he does not make proper release, so I wanted to share my knowledge with community. People deserve to know the truth, you know.

I realise that new <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr> is more advacned and have unique features, but with my heavy mod load I really started to care about perfomance. And I love volumetric clouds... And Mun shine.

Also it is possible to use good old Better Atmospheres or Astronomer's Packs with it.

Perfomance wise - when I look up to the sky through 2 layers of volumetric clouds I'm getting 75-85 FPS. When look down to the ground it may vary 25-45, depending on craft and scene.

Also consider this result achieved with Scatterer (with disabled godrays and water shaders) + Stock Visual Terrain + KerbinSide and about 100 of mods (gameplay and parts). 

For your info: my KSP install uses 10-12 GB of RAM. My PC : i5 @ 4400 MHz, Radeon 7950 @ 1140/1500 , 16 GB RAM, SSD

Just uploaded a new version. <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr> integration is in, sunflare fixes, ring-sunflare interactions, ring shadows, tracking station support as well as many bug fixes, full changelog in the <abbr title="Original Post(er). The first post in a thread, or the person who posted it.">OP</abbr>, please read it.

Quick beauty album here: [http://imgur.com/a/dhhFK](http://imgur.com/a/dhhFK)

This update might disrupt many of the exisinting visual packs because things simply look different now. There is still an option to use the old cloud shading however in the main menu.

For the screens I show and the settings I include, I use only the latest <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr> version from waz. For the Jool rings in the pics I used the rings from SVE.

Since installing the latest update, KSP and Firefox (?!?) seem to crash together. I don't know if this is a scatterer issue, but that's the only thing that's changed on my system since last night. Anything I can do to help you figure out what?
huuuuuuge performance hit with latest update and ocean is missing

[@blackrack](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/104258-blackrack/) [@Galileo](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/150430-galileo/) I just got the new Scatterer via CKAN, too. CKAN and the ZIP says **v300**, however, the ingame scatterer window says **v275 preview**. And it does not work well with the SVE configs. It has continous NREs and a **huge memory leak in combination with the SVE config**. That is going from 0 to max memory (swapping to death) in few seconds, as soon as entering a a savegame from main menu to space center. The memory allocation rises like a Saturn V. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)") At least in my install. With the config from the scatterer V300 zip files it works. Unfortunately the situation kills all CKAN SVE installs in the moment, I assume. So I don't know if it's a scatterer problem (it shows 275 preview) or a SVE problem, with the SVE configs kill the new scatterer. Quick Fix for people with problems, if you have SVE installed: -delete the gamedata\scatterer directory (which includes the SVE configs for scatterer) -install the new scatterer v300 manually or play without scatterer for now until this is fixed.
